author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...AIRCRAFT FINDS BARRY A LITTLE STRONGER... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...
summary: ...AIRCRAFT FINDS BARRY A LITTLE STRONGER... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS... As of 1:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 20.8, -96.6 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...AIRCRAFT FINDS BARRY A LITTLE STRONGER... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING ANTICIPATED OVER PARTS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS... As of 1:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 20.8, -96.6 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1006 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary for Tropical Storm Barry (AT2/AL022025)
